title: Vianna da Motta International Music Competition
text:
The Vianna da Motta International Music Competition was first constituted in 1957 in Lisbon in honor of <a href="Jos%C3%A9%20Vianna%20da%20Motta">José Vianna da Motta</a> by his disciple <a href="Sequeira%20Costa">Sequeira Costa</a>, who remains its president; this inaugural edition was won by <a href="Naum%20Shtarkman">Naum Shtarkman</a>. The competition, a member of the <a href="World%20Federation%20of%20International%20Music%20Competitions">World Federation of International Music Competitions</a>, has been held regularly since 1964.
Awards.
While mainly a piano competition, two violin editions have been held. In 1973 <a href="Ida%20Kavafian">Ida Kavafian</a> and <a href="Gerardo%20Ribeiro">Gerardo Ribeiro</a> shared the 1st prize. In 1991 it was declared void; Graf Mourja and Rachel Varga were awarded, respectively, the 2nd and 3rd prizes.
